author: lsankar
content:
in a post eip1559 merged eth1/eth2, would the ‘miner tip’ be wholly given to the block proposer or shared with attesters who attest to the tx's block? 

in other words, could tips/fees affect the attestation part of the fork-choice rule? trying to understand if there'll be an obvious mechanism similar to the replace-by-fee of today

author: sky.cactus
content: The `inclusion_fee_per_gas` variable needs to go to the person who constructs the block (decides which transactions to include).

author: lsankar
content: Oh maybe it isn’t necessary to influence attesters

author: mrabino1
content: pls forgive the naive question. post-merge, is the intent to retain the blocks having the same gas limit? or  will now-validators indicate an increase? thx

author: sky.cactus
content: I believe for the initial transition the gas limit will remain unchanged.  I don't know if PoS is planning on allowing for staker block size adjustment or not.

author: m.kalinin
content: It also depends on whether we have eip1559 released before or after the merge

author: m.kalinin
content: I suppose if it not happens _before_ then validators will be able to change the size of the block, likewise miners

author: sky.cactus
content: EIP-1559 doesn't matter for this really.  `block_gas_limit` before 1559/merge is `block_gas_target` after 1559/merge.

author: m.kalinin
content: You mean that `block_gas_target` retains as a variable  that can be changed by block producers?

author: jgm
content: I would hope that the latest that EIP-1559 comes in is _with_ the merge.  Having current TX fees going to stakers would be massively disproportionate to their block rewards, and once someone has something we have seen how hard it is to take that away again, even if it is for the overall benefit to all of the network's participants.

author: sky.cactus
content: 1559 already has it implemented, or plans to have it implemented (I'm not sure which as I don't follow closely).

author: m.kalinin
content: Then block producers, i.e. validators after the merge, will be able to vote for `block_gas_target` as miners are today.

author: sky.cactus
content: Assuming PoS retains that particular feature, yes.

author: mrabino1
content: thank you. appreciated. <@144468805697929216>, RE your point about coming in with the merge.. personally I tend to agree with this thinking.. primarily as until the merge, i believe it to be wise to minimize any economic confrontation with miners as a whole. ETH1 needs them. I am almost certainly in the minority on this next comment, but I am actually for increasing the block reward (even exponentially if needed) in the days leading upto the merge to ensure a smooth transition to PoS.. we cannot afford to hashpower drop-off and potentially expose the chain when it is the most vulnerable right before the merge...  for the record, I am not a miner, nor am i mining.. quite the other way around..  RE gas limit, i do hope that feature is brought across as post-merge anything that can be done to help w/ transactional flow is (in my eyes) on the critical path..
